title: Crypto crash updates, Sequoia’s structure, $ZM product expansion, Starlink & more | E1498
description: First, we cover an update from the BlockFi CEO denying that FTX is buying them for $25N (2:33), and we have a couple more crypto quick hits (5:51) before we touch on Sequoia's largest investments being down 70% (34:01). Klarna is raising way down at a $6B valuation (45:23), Zoom is looking to expand beyond video conferencing, (54:50), and the FCC approved Starlink to supply internet to moving vehicles (57:40). Finally, Rachel speaks with co-founder and CEO of Stages, Jared Downing, for this week's OK Boomer (1:08:23).
author: Jason Calacanis
excerpt: In this episode, Jason Calacanis discusses the BlockFi/FTX sale, CoinFlex's public feud, CFTC's fraud charge against Mirror Trading International, and the fall of Unity and DoorDash stocks. He also covers Klarna's latest funding round, Zoom's expansion plans, SpaceX's new Starlink authorization, and interviews Stages CEO Jared Downing.

All episodes

E1498 • Jul 1, 2022 • 91 mins

In this episode, Jason Calacanis discusses the BlockFi/FTX sale, CoinFlex's public feud, CFTC's fraud charge against Mirror Trading International, and the fall of Unity and DoorDash stocks. He also covers Klarna's latest funding round, Zoom's expansion plans, SpaceX's new Starlink authorization, and interviews Stages CEO Jared Downing.
